name: Hotel Koldingfjord

reviews.text: Like the location and the offered services. The rooms have a nice view of the fjord. Distance to downtown is OK, but require a small drive (10 min)
reviews.title: Nice place - my favourite in Kolding

reviews.text: We have now visited this hotel some seven times during summer and spring holidays; former the hotel was part of the Radison SAS Group and was (in the summer) more oriented to children and tourists. Now it has changed hands a couple years ago and its accent is on business/ conference public. Prices have gone up moderately, but the original interesting summer deals have gone. This year (in July) we found out a summer price of DK 1195 for a family of four (kids 6 and 9). Normal price DK 2390 and weekends DK 1895. Quite a price, but you get a lot: the room of our choice is either 505 or 502 in Dagmar Palae (sep. building in the courtyard). Wonderful large room, ample place, two large double beds, B&O TV; room service; just what we need, after a long day car travel (9 hrs.). Most staff has changed, but still professional, friendly, but distant. You don't get the welcoming feeling of the (reception) staff as it used to be. The inside swimming pool is ok for kids who can swin, but the bathrobes in the rooms and the towels at the pool are no longer there. The Lego toy and play corner, suitable for kids, has also vanished. The restaurant and breakfastbuffet is still very ok! Its location is excellent with wonderful views and (short) walks along the fjord. We tried on our way back from Norway another night, but prices had gone up with 700 DK, due to the end of the Summer offer. This offer parallels the Danish Schoolholidays (!?!), which end four weeks earlier than in our home and some other Europ. countries. The receptionist was strict and by the book. Basically I understand that, but no manager available or prepared to backup requests. The returning client was no issue and the formal and distant way I was attended made me back out decently. So we will let our next stop depend on the price than listed. But still, it is a remarkable and recommendable hotel for an enjoyable stay. And the famous Trapholt museum nearby.
reviews.title: Kids call it the Palace Hotel

reviews.text: PS One of the sinks in the bathroom was very slowly emptying, went to the reception desk for assistance or the famous simple tool; no way for solving the problem, the specialised staff member for slow emptying sinks was already off, but tomorrow morning , after we would have left we may have a solution (Sunday) ??
reviews.title: Beware - we were charged 45% more than price quoted

likes.disliked: — Excessive charge for small children on departure

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Koldingfjord - until it was time to check out. We were very happy to pay for the expensive wine and food - we had seen the menu up front. However, we were surprised to be charged an additional 45% of the quote given by Hotels.com for housing my two sons, age 4 and 1. The receptionist admitted that she had had the same response from many other guests.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel with splendid location

likes.disliked: — Nothing (it's a little pricey - but quality don't come cheap!)

reviews.text: The hotel itself is elegant and clean and the fjord is beautiful. However, on a weekend in July it felt rather empty and the bar and restaurant lacked atmosphere.
reviews.title: Good quality, but a bit unpersonal

reviews.text: With a picturesque fjord on one side and beautiful green forests on the other, this hotel is romantic, peaceful, beautiful – all in all, the perfect place for a stay. The hotel lies a bit on an uphill with a beautiful drive up through small winding roads. The building itself is extremely charming with a 100 year old history and owned by the then nurses' union. We got our rooms in the annex to the main building, which was also rustic and cozy. The rooms are big and done in a monochrome of whites that feel very soothing. There are big windows allowing ample of natural day light. There were Bang and Olufsen TV and Arne Jacobsen lampshades that spoke of good taste and quality of the interiors. The beds were comfortable and bathrooms were big and clean, supplied with hairdryer and organic toiletries. We were told that the hotel has a swimming pool, sauna and steam that we unfortunately did not get to use due to time crunch. The proximity of the hotel to the fjord and the forrest makes it an ideal place for runners and at the same time for relaxation. There is a boat docking area right in front of the hotel, owned by the hotel, where private boats can be moored. Therefore, it is also ideal for people on a sailing vacation.
reviews.title: A must stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lavish dinner at the restaurant that included a three course menu decided by the chef. Every single dish paired with the perfect wine was exquisite and prepared to perfection. Each ingredient used in the dishes were well thought of in terms of taste, texture, color, smell and aesthetics. This was definitely one of my best culinary experiences!!! The view of the fjord from the restaurant is breathtaking and that adds up to the pleasure of eating delicious food and drinking some very well paired wines. The staff is very friendly and they know what they are doing. The breakfast next day was also excellent. With a large spread, there were n number of fresh baked breads to choose from. There is a library with old collections courtesy of the days from when this hotel used to be a nursing home..
reviews.title: Not to be missed

reviews.text: This hotel is not to be missed. For both business travelers and people on vacation, this is an ideal location with charming interiors, remarkable views of the fjord and one of the best culinary experiences. A must stay for sure!
reviews.title: Best in the area of Kolding

reviews.text: Hotel Koldingfjord is definitely a great place to stay. We booked there because our LP guidebook was recommending it, and it was really a great choice. The building is big and resembles a manor house, with large hallways and likes. The library is particularly
reviews.title: Luxury in beautiful suroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: impressive, don't forget to visit it.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, friendly staff and proper full scale breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is a former sanatorium and has been nicely transformed to a hotel. It's a beautiful building and a great seafront location. Stayed in the "new" wing and had a comfortable designed room (yet pretty simple) with a wonderful view over the water. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom was good size but pretty standard. Poor amenities. No air-condition (!) and surprisingly ventilation was turned off automatically during the night. Lots of mosquitoes outside so didn’t dare open the window, hence, room became pretty warm during the night. An excellent and charming gourmet restaurant. Brilliant breakfast. Indoor swimming pool and sauna. The gym facilities unfortunately located next to sauna in a non air-conditioned room so virtually impossible to use. The general service very poor and very unfriendly. As a guest I felt more being a nuisance to the staff who clearly never have learned how to be polite or to smile. The Danish have a reputation of being “gemytliga” (jovial) although that’s more a myth. However, a stop overnight at hotel Koldingfjord one your way through Denmark is still a good choice and it could become much more interesting if the staff showed more interest.
reviews.title: Don't miss this one!

reviews.text: Forest, at waterfront, spacious rooms (I had a junior suite), clean and nice breakfast buffet. Probably also a nice getaway for a romantic weekend.
reviews.title: Very Nice, with an Impressive Breakfast Buffet

reviews.text: We only had one night in this lovely hotel but it was the nicest of our hotels in DK this trip! A little far out (we had a car) but worth the trip. HUGE room with tasteful furnishings (all Danish modern), great bath amenities and free Wifi. The bed was very comfortable. As we arrived late, we did not explore the surrounding area but it looked very calm and the view to the fjord was stunning. The hotel staff was very helpful. BREAKFAST was the best yet - fresh, plentiful and served well. The hotel was busy but the wait staff had everything well stocked and cleaned. We were impressed. The best was that we could make our 'lunches' from the buffet for 80DKr. As we were driving the Margarite Route each day, lunches were often an issue so this was wonderful...we got to have a great little lunch in a forest and it was great.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.text: This hotel has a fantastic location at the Kolding fjord seaside. The area is green and peaceful and there are some nice trails by the seaside where you can enjoy the scenery. The hotel is a bit out of the way if you plan on spending time in Kolding city centre.
reviews.title: High quality hotel- but pricey

likes.liked: — The fantastic location and wonderful rooms

reviews.title: nice summer stay
reviews.text: I did not as I was there on a conference so for me that was not an issue.

description: There are only few places where scenery, architecture and atmosphere come together to create a perfect experience. Hotel Koldingfjord is one of those rare places. Our charming buildings used to be a sanatorium. Placed in the forest, with a magnificent view over the water, it was a vitalising and inspiring place to gain strength. Today, Hotel Koldingfjord is not only a place to gain strength. It’s also a place to gather strength. Hotel Koldingfjord has 134 rooms, international conference facilities with room for up to 230 persons, as well as room for parties and events for up to 375 guests. Hotel Koldingfjord further includes a wine cellar, café, bar, pool and sauna, a large sun terrace, outdoor serving on a terrace, marked trails along the fjord and in the forest, as well as a unique view over Kolding Fjord. Regardless, whether you want to pay us a visit via work for courses/meetings or as a private guest for a stay or a party – we promise you that we will do our upmost to give you an once-in-a-lifetime experience!
